column4: Is there a file you can run to shut down your computer? Like in /usr or something
dont do that, that is not a good idea
remote shutdown using IRC is dangerous
IRC has no security, a malicious server could send the command to your machine and shut it down at any time
I have sufficient protection, and I'm only doing it once anyway o.O
go get putty or another ssh client, connect to your linux machine, type sudo poweroff
I'm looking for like... //run shutdown or something... chowmeined: If I was, I wouldn't be in here now would I?
you could have another linux machine but you are currently on windows..
I'm not...How can I //run somethingtomakeitdie in mIRC?
how are you running mIRC on linux?
A lot of people I know
i dont think i can help you, im sorry
I dont know how to do that off the top of my head, i could figure it out, but i wouldnt ever do it, id use ssh instead
